intro: Airopsis cupaniana, commonly known as the giant sea whip, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Zosteraceae. It is characterized by its long, branching stems covered in small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically found in clusters near the base of the stems. It thrives in shallow coastal waters and is often found in association with other seagrass species. Airopsis cupaniana plays a role in stabilizing sediments and providing habitat for various marine organisms.
